Module kopper.tetris
Package kopper.tetris.core

Class StartPauseScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • kopper.tetris.core.StartPauseScreen
  • public class StartPauseScreen
extends Object

    This class represents the drawing information for both game states: TetrisGame.State.GAME_PAUSED and TetrisGame.State.GAME_START_SCREEN. Specifically, this class draws the rounded rectangles that represent the Text pixel boundaries of all the screen information to be printed and the translucent layer over the (paused game logic but) ever still drawing running game screen.

    This class is was written to keep all of the complex pixel coordinates and all of the text pixel dimensions organized and properly calculated to be presented properly to the screen for the Pause and Start screens of this game. The pause and start screens differ in the title and subtitles drawn but otherwise present the same functional information about how to play and navigate the game.

    To see how the game over screen is drawn, one must see the one method that handles that simple screen: TetrisGame.paintGameOverScreen(Graphics2D).

    Author:
    KopperKnight

    • Method Detail

      • drawPauseScreen

        public void drawPauseScreen​(Graphics2D g2d)
        A Semantic method that calls a helper method drawScreen(g2d,true), which draws the pause screen. See drawScreen(Graphics2D, boolean) for details.
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object ultimately supplied by TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics).

      • drawStartScreen

        public void drawStartScreen​(Graphics2D g2d)
        A Semantic method that calls a helper method drawScreen(g2d,false), which draws the start screen. See drawScreen(Graphics2D, boolean) for details.
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object ultimately supplied by TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics).

      • drawScreen

        private void drawScreen​(Graphics2D g2d,
                        boolean isPaused)
        Draws the rounded rectangles that represent the Text pixel boundaries of all the screen information to be printed and the translucent layer over the paused game logic but ever still drawing running game screen. See TetrisGame.paintGameRunning(Graphics2D, kopper.tetris.core.TetrisGame.State).
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object ultimately supplied by TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics).
        isPaused - If true, the pause screen is drawn, if false, the start screen is drawn.

      • initRectangles

        private void initRectangles​(Graphics2D g2d)
        Initializes the rectangles that represent the Text pixel boundaries of all the screen information to be printed.
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object ultimately supplied by TetrisGame.paintComponent(Graphics).
